info.title: Mainio Platform API
info.description:
# Introduction
Welcome to the Mainio API documentation. This API follows REST principles and provides endpoints for managing tenants, agents, data sources, and more.

## Authentication
All API endpoints require authentication. For user authentication, users must be authenticated via session.

## Authorization
The API implements role-based access control.

## Common Patterns

### Resource Inclusion
Many endpoints support including related resources via the `include` query parameter:
```
GET /api/tenants/123?include=users,agents,datasources
```

### Response Format
All responses follow a consistent format:
```json
{
  "data": {}, // Response data
  "error": "Error message if any"
}
```

post.description:
Updates a user's password after authentication.
Users can only change their own password.

## Authentication
This endpoint requires authentication via:
- **Session-based auth**: Browser session cookie
- **Token-based auth**: `x-mainio-internal-token` header (origin validation enforced)

## Access Control
- Users can only change their own password (userId must match authenticated user)
- System role users cannot use this endpoint for other users

## Password Requirements
- Minimum length: 8 characters (enforced by schema)
- Passwords are salted and hashed using secure methods
- Salt is stored separately from the hash

## Security Notes
- Previous password is not required (relies on authentication)
- Password history is not tracked
- No password complexity requirements beyond length

newPassword: Password must be at least 8 characters

403.description: Forbidden - cannot change another user's password

error.message: You can only change your own password

post.description:
Authenticates a user with email and password credentials.
Returns a JWT token for API access.

## Authentication
This is a public endpoint - no authentication required.

## Access Control
- Public endpoint accessible to anyone
- Rate limiting applied to prevent brute force attacks

## User Types
1. **Mindhive Internal Users** (@mindhive.fi email)
   - Can authenticate from any tenant domain
   - Typically have system or admin roles

2. **Tenant Users** (regular email)
   - Must authenticate from their tenant's domain
   - Or provide explicit tenantId in request

## Tenant Resolution
For non-Mindhive users, tenant is determined by:
1. Explicit `tenantId` in request body
2. Hostname of the request (e.g., tenant1.mainio.app)

## Token Details
- Algorithm: HS256
- Expiration: 30 days
- Contains: user ID, email, name, role, tenant info

Logs out the current user session.

## Authentication
This endpoint accepts but doesn't require authentication:
- **Session-based auth**: Will clear the session if present
- **Token-based auth**: Client should discard the token
- **No auth**: Returns success (idempotent operation)

## Access Control
- Public endpoint - anyone can call it
- No rate limiting applied

## Logout Behavior

### For Session-based Auth (NextAuth)
- The actual session clearing is handled by NextAuth
- Client should call `/api/auth/signout` for proper session cleanup
- This endpoint exists for API consistency

### For JWT Token Auth
- Server doesn't maintain token state (stateless)
- Client is responsible for discarding the token
- No server-side invalidation occurs

## Security Notes
- No token blacklisting implemented
- Tokens remain valid until expiration
- For immediate revocation needs, implement token blacklisting

get.summary: Validate user session and get current user
get.description:
Validates the user session and returns current user information.

## Authentication
This endpoint supports two authentication methods:
- **JWT Bearer Token**: For mobile/API clients - `Authorization: Bearer <token>`
- **Session Cookie**: For web clients - Automatic via NextAuth

## Access Control
- Any authenticated user can access their own session information
- No role restrictions

## Authentication Flow
1. First checks for JWT Bearer token (mobile clients)
2. If no valid JWT, falls back to NextAuth session (web clients)
3. Always fetches fresh user data from database
4. Returns full user and tenant information

## Use Cases
- **Mobile Apps**: Validate JWT token on app launch
- **Web Apps**: Check session validity after page refresh
- **API Clients**: Verify token before making other requests

## Token Validation
- JWT tokens are verified using HMAC-SHA256
- Expired tokens return 401 Unauthorized
- Invalid signatures return 401 Unauthorized
- User must still exist in database

404.description: User not found (deleted after token creation)

get.description:
Returns the health status of the system and its dependent services.
This endpoint forwards the request to the backend health check and
wraps the response in the standard API format.

get.description: Returns the execution history of a specific job. System users can access any job's history, while other users can only access history of jobs from their tenant.

200.description: List of system jobs with pagination

get.description:
Establishes a Server-Sent Events connection with optional filters. Requires authentication and system user role.
The server sends events as lines prefixed with `data: ` followed by a JSON object and a blank line, per SSE spec.

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description:
JSON-encoded filter object specifying which events to receive. Pass as a single query string value.
Example: `{"message.created":[{"tenantId":"t1","agentId":"a1","chatId":"c1"}]}`

get.description: Returns system alerts and alert statistics

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of alerts to return

post.description: Creates a new alert rule for monitoring

get.description:
Returns comprehensive monitoring data including metrics, alerts, and health status
for the system dashboard.
Returns system metrics in Prometheus-compatible format or JSON

parameters.name: metrics
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of metric names to include

post.description: Records a custom metric value

get.description: Returns comprehensive validation cache statistics and performance metrics

parameters.name: cache
parameters.description: Which cache to get stats for

post.description: Performs cache operations like clearing, invalidation, etc.

get.description: Returns comprehensive session statistics for monitoring

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of relations to include (messages, agent, messageCount, feedbackCount)

get.description:
Opens a Server-Sent Events (SSE) stream for real-time chat communication by proxying
the connection to the AI backend service. This endpoint acts as a pure bridge between
the client and AI backend, with no additional business logic.

## Authentication
Requires a valid session token passed as a query parameter. The token is validated
by the AI backend service.

## Rate Limiting
- Limit: 10 requests per minute per IP/session
- Window: 60 seconds
- Headers: X-RateLimit-Limit, X-RateLimit-Remaining, X-RateLimit-Reset

## SSE Protocol (SSOT)
This endpoint proxies the AI backend SSE stream. Messages are emitted as:
- `event: message` with JSON payload matching SSOT streaming contracts

Core message types (discriminated by `type`):
- `CONNECTION_READY`  `{ type, timestamp, messageId, correlationId?, data: { chatId } }`
- `STREAM_DATA`  `{ type, timestamp, messageId, correlationId?, data: { content, role, isLast?, chatId, tokens? } }`
- `MESSAGE_COMPLETED`  `{ type, timestamp, messageId, correlationId?, data: { tempId, finalId } }`
- `ERROR`  `{ type, timestamp, messageId, correlationId?, data: { code, message, details? } }`

The stream ends with a `[DONE]` line after the final message.

## Error Handling
Errors are returned as SSE events with type 'ERROR' containing:
- code: Error code (e.g., RATE_LIMIT, VALIDATION_ERROR, API_ERROR)
- message: Human-readable error message
- details: Additional error context
- correlationId: Unique ID for tracking the request

parameters.name: chatId
parameters.description: Existing chat ID to continue a conversation

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The user's message to send to the AI

parameters.name: current_url
parameters.description: The current page URL for context

parameters.name: customVariables
parameters.description: JSON-encoded custom variables for the AI context

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: Remaining requests in the current window

X-Correlation-ID.description: Unique correlation ID for request tracking

get.summary: Get a specific agent data source
get.description:
Returns a specific data source associated with the agent. System users can access any
tenant's agent data sources, while other users can only access their own tenant's agent
data sources.

parameters.name: dataSourceId
parameters.description: The ID of the agent data source

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of relations to include (dataSource,dataSource.vectorDatabase,dataSource.vectorIndex)

parameters.name: dataSourceId
parameters.description: The ID of the agent data source

delete.summary: Remove a data source from an agent

parameters.name: dataSourceId
parameters.description: The ID of the agent data source

get.summary: Get all data sources for an agent
get.description: Returns all data sources associated with the specified agent. System users can access any tenant's agent data sources, while other users can only access their own tenant's agent data sources.

post.summary: Add a data source to an agent
Restore agent to a specific revision
post.description: Restores an agent to a specific revision. System users can restore any tenant's agent, while other users can only restore their own tenant's agents. When restoring an agent: - The agent's state is reverted to the specified revision - The agent's revision number is set to the restored revision - Future revisions are preserved until changes are made - Making changes to a restored state creates a new branch Branching behavior: 1. When you restore to revision N 2. The agent is set to that state with revision = N 3. Future revisions (>N) remain in history 4. If you make changes after restoring: - A new revision N+1 is created - All revisions >N are deleted - A new branch of history starts from N+1

parameters.name: revision
parameters.description: The revision number to restore to

chatConfig.welcomeMessage: Hello! How can I help you today?

get.description: Returns a list of revisions for a specific agent. System users can access any tenant's agent revisions, while other users can only access their own tenant's agent revisions. Each revision represents a point in time when the agent was modified, including: - Full updates via PUT endpoint - Partial updates via PATCH endpoint - Restorations to previous versions The list is ordered by revision number in descending order (newest first).

Returns a specific agent by ID with role-based field filtering.

## Authentication
This endpoint requires authentication via:
- **Session-based auth**: Browser session cookie
- **Token-based auth**: `x-mainio-internal-token` header (origin validation enforced)

## Access Control
- **System role**: Can access any tenant's agents with all fields
- **Admin/User roles**: Can only access their own tenant's agents with restricted fields

## Field Filtering by Role
- **System users**: Full access including `instructions` and `config`
- **Non-system users**: Limited to: `id`, `name`, `description`, `tenantId`, `createdAt`, `updatedAt`

## Features
- Field selection with role-based filtering
- Include related data (tenant, functions, datasources, chats)
- Sort related collections (e.g., chats by createdAt or title)
- Relation counting with _count

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of relations to include

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
Comma-separated list of fields to return. Field access is filtered by user role.

System users can access: `id`, `tenantId`, `name`, `description`, `instructions`, `config`, `createdAt`, `updatedAt`

Non-system users limited to: `id`, `tenantId`, `name`, `description`, `createdAt`, `updatedAt`

parameters.name: chatsSortBy
parameters.description: Field to sort chats by (when chats are included)

put.summary: Update a specific agent and create a new revision
put.description:
Updates a specific agent by ID and creates a new revision.

## Authentication
This endpoint requires authentication via:
- **Session-based auth**: Browser session cookie
- **Token-based auth**: `x-mainio-internal-token` header (origin validation enforced)

## Access Control
- **System role**: Can update agents in any tenant
- **Admin role**: Can update agents in their own tenant
- **User role**: Cannot update agents (403 Forbidden)

## Revision System
When updating an agent:
- A new revision is automatically created
- The revision number is incremented
- The previous state is preserved in the revision history
- If updating from a restored state, future revisions are cleaned up
- Agent cache is flushed after update

## Update Behavior
- This is a full update (PUT) - all updateable fields should be provided
- Fields not included will be set to their defaults
- Use PATCH for partial updates
- Some fields cannot be updated (id, tenantId, createdAt)

value.name: Updated Support Agent
value.instructions: You are an expert support agent. Be helpful and professional.

data.name: Updated Support Agent
data.instructions: You are an expert support agent. Be helpful and professional.

delete.description:
Permanently deletes a specific agent by ID.

## Authentication
This endpoint requires authentication via:
- **Session-based auth**: Browser session cookie
- **Token-based auth**: `x-mainio-internal-token` header (origin validation enforced)

## Access Control
- **System role**: Can delete agents in any tenant
- **Admin role**: Can delete agents in their own tenant
- **User role**: Cannot delete agents (403 Forbidden)

## Deletion Behavior
- Deletion is permanent and cannot be undone
- All associated data is cascade deleted:
  - Agent revision history
  - Agent-datasource mappings
  - Agent-function mappings
  - Chat history and messages
- Agent cache is flushed after deletion

## Important Notes
- Consider backing up agent configuration before deletion
- Active chat sessions will be terminated
- Embedded chat widgets will stop functioning

parameters.name: agentId
parameters.description: The ID of the agent to delete

patch.summary: Partially update a specific agent's JSON fields and create a new revision
patch.description:
Performs targeted updates to JSON fields of an agent and creates a new revision.

## Authentication
This endpoint requires authentication via:
- **Session-based auth**: Browser session cookie
- **Token-based auth**: `x-mainio-internal-token` header (origin validation enforced)

## Access Control
- **System role**: Can update agents in any tenant
- **Admin role**: Can update agents in their own tenant
- **User role**: Cannot update agents (403 Forbidden)

## JSON Patch Operations
Supports three operations on JSON fields:
- **set**: Set a value at a specific path (creates path if needed)
- **delete**: Remove a value at a specific path
- **merge**: Merge an object into existing value at path

## Supported Fields
- **config**: Agent configuration (theme, features, behavior)
- **instructions**: Can be updated as structured JSON

## Revision System
- Creates a new revision with each update
- Preserves full history
- Flushes agent cache after update

## Path Syntax
Use dot notation for nested paths:
- `theme.primaryColor`
- `features.chat.enabled`
- `translations.en.welcomeMessage`

operation.value: Welcome! How can I help you today?

get.summary: Get all agents for a tenant
get.description: Returns all agents for the specified tenant with role-based field filtering. ## Authentication This endpoint requires authentication via: - **Session-based auth**: Browser session cookie - **Token-based auth**: `x-mainio-internal-token` header with `x-mainio-origin` ## Access Control - **System role**: Can access any tenant's agents and see all fields - **Admin/User roles**: Can only access their own tenant's agents with restricted fields ## Field Filtering by Role - **System users**: Full access to all fields including `instructions` and `config` - **Non-system users**: Limited to: `id`, `name`, `description`, `tenantId`, `createdAt`, `updatedAt` ## Features - Field selection with role-based filtering - Relation includes (tenant, functions, dataSources, chats) - Sorting by name, createdAt, or updatedAt - Pagination with configurable page size (max 100) - Relation counting with _count parameter

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of relations to include

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of fields to return. Field access is filtered by user role. System users can access: `id`, `tenantId`, `name`, `description`, `instructions`, `config`, `createdAt`, `updatedAt` Non-system users limited to: `id`, `tenantId`, `name`, `description`, `createdAt`, `updatedAt`

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number (0-based) or 'all' to disable pagination

200.description: List of agents with role-based field filtering applied

post.summary: Create a new agent for a tenant
post.description: Creates a new AI agent for the specified tenant. ## Authentication This endpoint requires authentication via: - **Session-based auth**: Browser session cookie - **Token-based auth**: `x-mainio-internal-token` header with `x-mainio-origin` ## Access Control - **System role**: Can create agents for any tenant - **Admin role**: Can create agents only in their own tenant - **User role**: Not authorized to create agents ## Agent Creation When creating an agent: - `name` is required and must be unique within the tenant - `description` is optional but recommended - `instructions` can be a string or structured object - `config` is optional and can contain UI/behavior settings - Initial revision is set to 0 ## Validation Input is validated using Zod schema with: - Name trimming and length validation (1-255 chars) - Instructions trimming and length validation (max 20000 chars) - Automatic tenant ID assignment

value.name: Customer Support Agent
value.description: AI assistant for handling customer inquiries
value.instructions: You are a helpful customer support agent. Be polite and professional.

data.name: Customer Support Agent
data.description: AI assistant for handling customer inquiries
data.instructions: You are a helpful customer support agent. Be polite and professional.

error.message: An agent with this name already exists in the tenant

get.summary: Get chat statistics for a tenant
get.description: Retrieves chat statistics including total chats, messages per agent, and average messages per chat

get.summary: Open a crawler events stream connection
get.description:
Opens a Server-Sent Events (SSE) stream for real-time crawler status updates
and progress monitoring. The stream provides live updates for web crawling jobs
including page processing, content extraction, and error notifications.

## Authentication
Requires a valid session token passed as a query parameter.

## Rate Limiting
- Limit: 10 requests per minute per IP/session
- Window: 60 seconds
- Headers: X-RateLimit-Limit, X-RateLimit-Remaining, X-RateLimit-Reset

## SSE Protocol
The response is a Server-Sent Events stream with the following event types:
- `CONNECTION_READY`: Stream connection established
- `CRAWLER_EVENT`: Crawler status and progress updates
- `ERROR`: Error events with structured error data

## Event Types
Crawler events include: crawler_started, crawler_stopped, page_completed,
content_extracted, progress_update, crawler_failed, and more.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: Optional job ID to filter events for a specific crawl job

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: Remaining requests in the current window

X-Correlation-ID.description: Unique correlation ID for request tracking

get.summary: Index a document's content into the vector database.
get.description: Forwards the indexing request to the jobs service to index the combined document content and streams back Server-Sent Events (SSE) indicating the progress. Note: This endpoint is restricted to system-level access only.

parameters.name: chunk_size
parameters.description: Optional configuration for chunk size during indexing.

parameters.name: chunk_overlap
parameters.description: Optional configuration for chunk overlap during indexing.

parameters.name: max_chunk_size
parameters.description: Optional configuration for maximum chunk size during indexing.

parameters.name: preserve_hierarchy
parameters.description: Optional configuration to preserve hierarchy during indexing.

200.description: Successfully initiated indexing. The response is a stream of server-sent events (SSE) indicating the progress of the indexing job.

schema.description: A stream of Server-Sent Events. Each event's data structure is defined by the jobs service. Events may include progress updates, logs, or completion status.

get.description: Returns a specific document by ID. System users can access any tenant's document, while other users can only access their own tenant's documents. Supports including related data through the "include" query parameter. If the "download" query parameter is provided, the response returns the document content as a downloadable file (using the document's "html" field if available, or falling back to "markdown") instead of the JSON object.

parameters.name: dataSourceId
parameters.description: The ID of the data source

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of relations to include (e.g., dataSource, tenant, chunks)

parameters.name: download
parameters.description: If true, returns the document content as a downloadable file (using the "html" or "markdown" field) instead of a JSON response.

put.description: Updates a document for the datasource. System users can update any tenant's documents, while other users can only update their own tenant's documents.

delete.description: Deletes an existing document. Only available to tenant admins and system users.

post.summary: Split a document's markdown content into chunks
post.description: Forwards the parsing request to the jobs service and returns the split chunks along with statistics. Note: This endpoint is restricted to system-level access only.

requestBody.description: Markdown content with optional splitting configuration.

get.description: Returns the total count of documents in the datasource or with a specific status.

200.description: The total count of documents in the datasource or with a specific status.

get.description:
Streams real-time updates about the document indexing process for a specific data source.

## Authentication
This endpoint requires authentication via:
- **Session-based auth**: Browser session cookie
- **Token-based auth**: `x-mainio-internal-token` header with `x-mainio-origin`

## Access Control
- **System role only**: This is a system administration endpoint
- Other roles will receive a 403 Forbidden response

## SSE Protocol
The response is a Server-Sent Events stream with the following event types:
- `progress`: Indexing progress updates with current document count
- `document`: Individual document processing status
- `error`: Error events for failed documents
- `complete`: Final event when indexing is complete

## Event Format
```
event: progress
data: {"processed": 10, "total": 100, "percentage": 10}

event: document
data: {"id": "doc123", "url": "https://example.com", "status": "indexed"}

event: error
data: {"documentId": "doc456", "error": "Failed to extract content"}

event: complete
data: {"processed": 100, "successful": 98, "failed": 2, "duration": 45.3}
```

## Processing Behavior
- Documents are processed in batches for efficiency
- Failed documents are logged but don't stop the process
- Progress is reported in real-time
- The stream closes automatically when complete

parameters.name: dataSourceId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the data source

parameters.name: forceOverride
parameters.description:
Whether to force re-indexing of already indexed documents.
- `false`: Skip documents that are already indexed
- `true`: Re-index all documents regardless of current status

200.description: Stream of document indexing progress events

post.summary: Log an event for a data source
post.description: Creates a new event log entry for the data source. System users can log events for any tenant's data source, while other users can only log events for their own tenant's data sources.

parameters.name: dataSourceId
parameters.description: The ID of the data source

get.description: Returns a paginated list of documents for the specified datasource

parameters.name: startsWith
parameters.description: Filter documents where URL starts with this value

parameters.name: contains
parameters.description: Filter documents where URL contains this value

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of fields to include in the response

post.summary: Create a new document for a datasource
post.description: Creates a new document for the specified datasource. System users can create documents for any tenant.
Creates or updates a document based on URL matching. Detects significant content changes to avoid unnecessary re-indexing.

get.summary: Get events for a data source
get.description: Returns paginated events for the specified data source. System users can access any tenant's events, while other users can only access their own tenant's events. Supports pagination and sorting by creation date.

parameters.name: dataSourceId
parameters.description: The ID of the data source

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of events to return (default: 10, max: 50)

200.description: List of events with pagination info

get.description: Retrieves a specific datasource for the tenant. System users can get any tenant's datasources, while other users can only get their own tenant's datasources. Supports including related data through the include query parameter.

put.description: Updates a datasource for the tenant. System users can update any tenant's datasources, while other users can only update their own tenant's datasources.

post.summary: Search a datasource and return elaborated phrase and results
post.description: Forwards search queries from the client to the main AI backend service.
Proxies document cleaning request to jobs service

get.summary: List all data sources for a tenant with filtering and relations
get.description:
Returns all data sources for the specified tenant with optional related data.

## Authentication
This endpoint requires authentication via:
- **Session-based auth**: Browser session cookie
- **Token-based auth**: `x-mainio-internal-token` header (origin validation enforced)

## Access Control
- **System role**: Can access data sources in any tenant
- **Admin/User roles**: Can only access data sources in their own tenant

## Data Source Types
- **Website**: Web scraping data sources
- **Document**: File upload data sources (PDF, DOCX, etc.)
- **API**: External API integrations
- **Database**: Database connections
- **Custom**: Custom data source implementations

## Relations Available
- **vectorDatabase**: Vector database configuration
- **vectorIndex**: Vector index for semantic search
- **embedModel**: Embedding model configuration
- **tenant**: Tenant information
- **documents**: Associated documents
- **agents**: Agents using this data source
- **events**: Processing and indexing events

## Field Filtering
Use `fields` parameter to reduce response size:
- Core fields: `id`, `tenantId`, `name`, `type`, `description`
- Config fields: `config`, `createdAt`, `updatedAt`
- Relation counts: `_count.documents`, `_count.agents`

## Sorting Related Collections
- Documents can be sorted by `createdAt` or `name`
- Events can be sorted by `createdAt` or `type`
- Default sort is `createdAt` descending

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of relations to include

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of fields to return

parameters.name: documentsSortBy

post.summary: Create a new data source for a tenant
post.description:
Creates a new data source for the specified tenant with automatic event tracking.

## Authentication
This endpoint requires authentication via:
- **Session-based auth**: Browser session cookie
- **Token-based auth**: `x-mainio-internal-token` header (origin validation enforced)

## Access Control
- **System role**: Can create data sources in any tenant
- **Admin/User roles**: Can create data sources only in their own tenant

## Data Source Types
- **website**: Web scraping (requires URL and crawl config)
- **document**: File uploads (requires file handling config)
- **api**: External API integration (requires API config)
- **database**: Database connection (requires connection config)
- **custom**: Custom implementation (requires custom config)

## Configuration Requirements
Each data source type requires specific configuration:
- **Website**: `url`, `crawlDepth`, `allowedDomains`, `excludePaths`
- **Document**: `allowedTypes`, `maxFileSize`, `processingOptions`
- **API**: `endpoint`, `authentication`, `refreshSchedule`
- **Database**: `connectionString`, `tables`, `syncSchedule`

## Automatic Features
- Creates initial "created" event for tracking
- Broadcasts event to connected clients
- Validates configuration against type requirements
- Sets up vector database integration if specified

## Event System
After creation, the data source will generate events for:
- Processing status updates
- Document indexing progress
- Error notifications
- Configuration changes

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: The ID of the tenant where data source will be created

value.name: Company Website
value.description: Main company website content for customer support

data.name: Company Website
data.description: Main company website content for customer support

config: URL is required for website type

type: Type must be one of: website, document, api, database, custom

get.summary: List all jobs for a tenant with filtering and execution history
get.description:
Returns all jobs for the specified tenant with optional execution history and filtering.

## Authentication
This endpoint requires authentication via:
- **Session-based auth**: Browser session cookie
- **Token-based auth**: `x-mainio-internal-token` header (origin validation enforced)

## Access Control
- **System role**: Can access jobs in any tenant
- **Admin/User roles**: Can only access jobs in their own tenant

## Job Types
- **data_source_crawl**: Web crawling jobs
- **document_processing**: Document indexing jobs
- **vector_index_update**: Vector database updates
- **data_sync**: External data synchronization
- **cleanup**: Maintenance and cleanup tasks
- **analytics**: Analytics processing
- **custom**: Custom job implementations

## Job States
- **queued**: Waiting to be executed
- **running**: Currently executing
- **completed**: Successfully completed
- **failed**: Failed with error
- **cancelled**: Manually cancelled
- **scheduled**: Scheduled for future execution

## Relations Available
- **executions**: Job execution history with status and timing
- **tenant**: Tenant information

## Field Selection
Use `fields` parameter to reduce response size:
- Core fields: `id`, `tenantId`, `name`, `type`, `status`, `priority`
- Config fields: `description`, `config`, `queue`, `maxAttempts`, `timeout`
- Scheduling fields: `scheduled`, `cronString`
- Timestamps: `createdAt`, `updatedAt`

## Sorting
- Jobs can be sorted by `createdAt`, `name`, `type`, `priority`
- Executions can be sorted by `createdAt`, `status`
- Default sort is `createdAt` descending

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of relations to include

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of fields to return

parameters.name: executionsSortBy
parameters.description: Field to sort executions by (when executions are included)

post.summary: Create a new background job for a tenant
post.description:
Creates a new background job for the specified tenant with automatic queuing.

## Authentication
This endpoint requires authentication via:
- **Session-based auth**: Browser session cookie
- **Token-based auth**: `x-mainio-internal-token` header (origin validation enforced)

## Access Control
- **System role**: Can create jobs in any tenant
- **Admin/User roles**: Can create jobs only in their own tenant

## Job Types and Configurations

### data_source_crawl
Crawls websites for content indexing:
```json
{
  "config": {
    "dataSourceId": "clh1234...",
    "maxPages": 100,
    "respectRobotsTxt": true
  }
}
```

### document_processing
Processes uploaded documents:
```json
{
  "config": {
    "documentIds": ["clh1234...", "clh5678..."],
    "extractImages": false,
    "chunkSize": 1000
  }
}
```

### vector_index_update
Updates vector database indexes:
```json
{
  "config": {
    "vectorDatabaseId": "clh1234...",
    "batchSize": 100,
    "force": false
  }
}
```

## Priority Levels
- **high**: Critical jobs that should run immediately
- **medium**: Standard priority (default)
- **low**: Background tasks that can wait

## Scheduling
- **Immediate**: `scheduled: false` (default)
- **Delayed**: `scheduled: true` with `scheduledAt`
- **Recurring**: `scheduled: true` with `cronString`

## Job Configuration
- Each job type requires specific configuration
- Configuration is validated against job type requirements
- Invalid configurations return 400 Bad Request

## Execution Limits
- `maxAttempts`: Maximum retry attempts (default: 3)
- `timeout`: Maximum execution time in milliseconds
- Jobs exceeding limits are marked as failed

get.summary: List users in a tenant with pagination and filtering
get.description:
Retrieves a paginated list of users within a specific tenant.

## Authentication
This endpoint requires authentication via:
- **Session-based auth**: Browser session cookie
- **Token-based auth**: `x-mainio-internal-token` header (origin validation enforced)

## Access Control
- **System role**: Can list users in any tenant
- **Admin role**: Can list users only in their own tenant
- **User role**: Cannot list users (403 Forbidden)

## Field Selection
- Default fields: `id`, `name`, `email`, `role`, `tenantId`, `createdAt`, `updatedAt`
- Sensitive fields excluded: `password`, `salt`, `emailVerified`
- Custom field selection via `fields` parameter

## Pagination Options
- Standard pagination: Use `page` and `pageSize` parameters
- Fetch all: Use `page=all` to get all users in a single response
- Maximum page size: 100 users per page
- Zero-based page numbering

## Sorting
- Sortable fields: `email`, `name`, `role`, `createdAt`, `updatedAt`
- Default sort: `email` ascending
- Use `sortBy` and `order` parameters to customize

## Performance Notes
- Results are optimized for admin dashboards
- Large tenants should use pagination instead of `page=all`
- Field selection reduces response size

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of fields to select

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number (0-based) or 'all' to fetch all users

200.description: Paginated list of users retrieved successfully

post.summary: Create a new user in a tenant
post.description:
Creates a new user within a specific tenant with proper password hashing and validation.

## Authentication
This endpoint requires authentication via:
- **Session-based auth**: Browser session cookie
- **Token-based auth**: `x-mainio-internal-token` header (origin validation enforced)

## Access Control
- **System role**: Can create users in any tenant with any role
- **Admin role**: Can create users only in their own tenant (cannot create system users)
- **User role**: Cannot create users (403 Forbidden)

## User Creation Rules
- Email must be unique across the system
- Password is securely hashed with salt before storage
- User is automatically assigned to the specified tenant
- Default role is 'user' if not specified

## Role Restrictions
- Only system users can create other system users
- Admin users cannot create system users
- Admin users can create admin and user roles

## Validation Rules
- Name: 1-255 characters, required
- Email: Valid email format, unique, required
- Password: Minimum 6 characters, required
- Role: Must be valid enum value (user, admin, system)
- Image: Optional URL to profile picture

## Security Features
- Passwords are hashed using bcrypt with salt
- Sensitive fields excluded from response
- Email uniqueness enforced at database level
- Role-based access control validated
